channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Meet the brave 6 Operation Sindoor heroes awarded the Vir Chakra
Why Trump has cancelled his talks with Putin in Budapest
History Today: When India launched the Chandrayaan-1
FirstUp: EU-Egypt summit in Brussels, King Charles to visit the Vatican... The headlines of the day
Why Japan has lifted the ban on OTC morning-after pill for the first time
How a strapless wedding gown is at centre of a political scandal in Iran
Indo-Pacific's summit season is on: How the region will manage Trump factor
item.description: The paradox of Donald Trump’s Indo-Pacific diplomacy is that his presence is unpredictable, his absence consequential, and his impact uncertain

item.title: Ceasefire under fire: Gaza peace efforts falter amid new Israel-Hamas clashes
item.description: Fear and panic are again dominating the scene among people in Gaza after Israel’s military launched more than 20 airstrikes

item.title: How India–Canada quietly steer through Trumpian storm
item.description: The departure of Justin Trudeau as Canadian prime minister and the return of Donald Trump as US president prompted Canada to accelerate its search for allies in Europe and Asia—making a renewed focus on ties with India both strategic and inevitable

item.title: How Trump’s off-the-cuff remarks won’t make India compromise redlines
item.description: Whatever course the US takes, it will ultimately have to remain within India's redlines, as India continues to expand its oil procurements and defence purchases from diverse global sources in pursuit of its national interests

item.title: US Sutra | Trump handling: How to tackle India’s foreign policy challenge
item.description: With Shehbaz Sharif’s flattery falling flat and with China’s squeeze on rare earths, India has a new opening

item.title: Why many Sikhs visit Gwalior on Diwali
item.description: On Diwali day, when Guru Hargobind walked out to freedom, each of the imprisoned kings held one hem and walked behind him, thus creating a mass Bandi Chorr Diwas which is commemorated till today across gurudwaras
